No-Bake Cannoli Cups

Jump to Recipe

Are you searching for a delightful dessert that combines rich flavors with effortless preparation? Look no further than these No-Bake Cannoli Cups! Perfect for any occasion, this easy cannoli-inspired treat brings the classic Italian dessert into a convenient and bite-sized form. With a creamy ricotta filling sweetened with powdered sugar and a hint of vanilla, every mini phyllo cup is a burst of deliciousness. Topped with chocolate chips and crunchy pistachios, this dessert not only tastes incredible but also presents beautifully. It's a great way to impress your guests without spending hours in the kitchen. Plus, since there’s no baking involved, you can whip these up quickly, making them an ideal choice for parties, potlucks, or a sweet end to a weeknight dinner. Let’s dive into the ingredients and the simple steps to create these irresistible No-Bake Cannoli Cups!

Ingredients

mini phyllo cups

Mini phyllo cups are a convenient base for many desserts. If you can't find them, you can make your own by layering sheets of phyllo dough, brushing them with melted butter, and cutting them into small circles to mold into muffin tins. Ensure you bake them until crisp before filling.

ricotta cheese

Use whole milk ricotta for a creamier texture. If you're looking for a lighter option, part-skim ricotta works well too. For a smoother filling, you can blend the ricotta cheese in a food processor before mixing with other ingredients. If you need a dairy-free option, consider using cashew cream as a substitute.

powdered sugar

Powdered sugar is ideal for sweetening without grittiness. If you want a lower sugar option, consider using a sugar substitute like erythritol or monk fruit sweetener, but be aware that the flavor may vary slightly. Sift the powdered sugar before using to avoid clumps.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor; imitation vanilla can have a less pleasant taste. For an alternative flavor, you can try almond extract or a splash of citrus zest (like lemon or orange) for a different twist.

chocolate chips

Semi-sweet chocolate chips are classic for a balance of sweetness and richness. If you want a darker flavor, consider using dark chocolate chips. For a healthier option, you can use cacao nibs or even chopped dark chocolate. Make sure to fold them in gently to maintain their shape.

chopped pistachios

Chopped pistachios add a lovely crunch and color. If you don't have pistachios, you can substitute with chopped walnuts or almonds. For a nut-free option, consider using sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds for a similar crunch.

ground cinnamon

Ground cinnamon enhances the flavor profile beautifully. For a more complex flavor, try using a pinch of nutmeg or allspice alongside the cinnamon. Always check the freshness of your spices, as older spices can lose their potency.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients

    Gather all your ingredients: 12 mini phyllo cups, 1 cup of ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup of powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1/4 cup of chocolate chips, 2 tablespoons of chopped pistachios, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Make sure to measure everything out before you start to streamline the process.

  • Step 2: Mix the Ricotta Filling

    In a mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon. Use a hand mixer or a whisk to mix these ingredients together until the mixture is smooth and creamy. This step is crucial; the texture of your filling should be light and fluffy.

  • Step 3: Fold in the Chocolate Chips

    Once your ricotta mixture is smooth, gently fold in the chocolate chips using a spatula. Be careful not to overmix, as you want to keep some of the airiness in the mixture. This will ensure a delightful texture in every bite.

  • Step 4: Fill the Phyllo Cups

    Take the mini phyllo cups and spoon the ricotta mixture into each one until they are filled to the top. You can use a small cookie scoop or a spoon for this step. Make sure to fill them evenly for a balanced flavor in each cup.

  • Step 5: Add the Toppings

    Sprinkle the chopped pistachios over the top of each filled cup for added crunch and flavor. This not only enhances the visual appeal but also adds a nice textural contrast to the creamy filling.

  • Step 6: Serve or Chill

    You can serve the cannoli cups immediately for a fresh taste, or refrigerate them for up to an hour to let the flavors meld together. If chilling, cover them lightly with plastic wrap to avoid condensation.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to mix the ricotta cheese for a smooth texture?

To achieve a smooth texture, use a hand mixer or a whisk to beat the ricotta cheese with the powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon. Start at a low speed and gradually increase to avoid splattering.

Can I substitute any ingredients in this recipe?

Yes, you can substitute ricotta cheese with mascarpone or cream cheese for a different flavor. You can also use honey or maple syrup instead of powdered sugar for a natural sweetener.

How do I make sure the mini phyllo cups don't get soggy?

To prevent sogginess, fill the mini phyllo cups just before serving. If you need to prepare them in advance, refrigerate the filling separately and assemble shortly before serving.

What if I don't have mini phyllo cups?

If you don't have mini phyllo cups, consider using crushed graham crackers or a small tart shell as a base. You can also serve the ricotta mixture in small glasses or bowls.

How do I know when the ricotta mixture is ready?

The ricotta mixture is ready when it is smooth and creamy without any lumps. Taste it to ensure the sweetness is to your liking.

Can I add other toppings besides pistachios?

Absolutely! You can top your cannoli cups with crushed cookies, fresh fruit, or a drizzle of chocolate or caramel sauce for extra flavor.

How long can these cannoli cups be stored?

These cannoli cups can be kept in the refrigerator for up to 1 hour before serving. If you need to store them longer, keep the filling and cups separate and assemble just before serving.

What kitchen tools will I need for this recipe?

You'll need a mixing bowl, a hand mixer or whisk, a spoon for filling, and a measuring cup and spoons for measuring ingredients.

How do I prevent the chocolate chips from sinking in the filling?

To prevent the chocolate chips from sinking, you can toss them in a little bit of flour before folding them into the mixture. This helps them stay suspended.

Is there an easy way to fold the chocolate chips into the mixture?

Yes! Use a rubber spatula and gently scoop from the bottom of the bowl, folding the mixture over the chocolate chips to incorporate them without deflating the mixture.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with gluten sensitivities, ensure to use gluten-free mini phyllo cups. You can also substitute the ricotta cheese with a vegan alternative made from cashews or tofu blended with a bit of lemon juice for a dairy-free option. For a lower sugar alternative, consider using a sugar substitute in the ricotta mixture. Additionally, feel free to omit the chocolate chips or replace them with dried fruits or berries for a different flavor profile.

Pairings

The No-Bake Cannoli Cups pair beautifully with a variety of dessert wines such as Vin Santo or Moscato d'Asti, which complement the sweetness of the ricotta filling. For a non-alcoholic option, consider serving with a rich, creamy Italian hot chocolate or a coffee with a hint of vanilla. Additionally, a light dusting of cocoa powder on top or a drizzle of chocolate sauce can enhance the chocolate notes in the dish.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the No-Bake Cannoli Cups on a decorative platter, garnished with a sprinkle of additional chopped pistachios and a light dusting of powdered sugar for visual appeal. For added flair, you can place a few fresh mint leaves around the cups or alongside them to provide a pop of color. Consider serving them with small dessert forks or spoons for easy handling, especially during gatherings. If serving at a party, arrange them in tiers for a stunning presentation.

No-Bake Cannoli Cups

15 min
$10
220 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Description

Delicious, creamy cannoli filling served in crispy cups without the need for baking!

Ingredients

  • mini phyllo cups: 12
  • ricotta cheese: 1 cup
  • powdered sugar: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • chocolate chips: 1/4 cup
  • chopped pistachios: 2 tablespoons
  • ground cinnamon: 1/4 teaspoon
